result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond C Lightning

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defn in custody; Defn waived right to atty (verbal); Witness duly sworn & testified; Witness ID'd defn; Defn duly sworn & testified; State moves for bindover; Ct binds case over; Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry and remain compliant.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br  7

2:21 PM Defendant Raymond C Lightning in court in custody.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Raymond C Lightning.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
